episodeTitle: A Special Retrospective Before Marineford! The Vow of the Brotherhood!
episodeTitleJapanese: 海軍本部直前回想特別編 兄弟の誓い
episodeTitleRomanized: Marinfōdo Chokuzen Kaisō Supesharu - Kyōdai no Chikai
description: As Luffy recovers on Level 5.5 of Impel Down, he reflects on his relationship with Ace. The episode recounts their childhood bond, Ace giving Luffy his Vivre Card in Arabasta, Luffy's first encounter with Blackbeard in Mock Town, learning of Ace's execution, and confronting Blackbeard at Impel Down. Meanwhile, Ace awaits his execution at Marineford, three hours before the scheduled time, recalling his defeat by Blackbeard.

events.title: Luffy Watches Ace's Vivre Card Burn
events.description: In the present timeline on Level 5.5 of Impel Down, Luffy anxiously watches Ace's Vivre Card continue to burn, indicating his brother's life force weakening. Jinbe sits beside him, providing companionship during this tense moment.
events.significance: This framing device establishes the emotional stakes of the episode and sets up the retrospective journey through Luffy and Ace's relationship. The burning Vivre Card serves as a visual representation of time running out.

events.title: Flashback: Luffy and Ace's Childhood Bond
events.description: Luffy recalls memories of his childhood with Ace, showing them eating together, sleeping together, and training together. The flashback emphasizes their inseparable bond and the foundation of their brotherhood.
events.significance: Establishes the deep emotional connection between Luffy and Ace that motivates Luffy's desperate attempt to save his brother. This retrospective reinforces the core relationship that drives the entire Summit War Saga.

quotes.text: We've always been together... eating, sleeping, training...
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy reflecting on his childhood with Ace

events.title: Flashback: Ace and Luffy's Reunion in Arabasta
events.description: The episode recounts Luffy and Ace's reunion in Arabasta, where Ace explains his pride in being part of the Whitebeard Pirates. Ace shows Luffy the mark on his back representing his allegiance to Whitebeard, whom he respects deeply.
events.significance: This flashback establishes Ace's loyalty to Whitebeard, which becomes crucial context for understanding the Marineford War and why Whitebeard is willing to risk everything to save Ace.

quotes.text: This mark on my back is my pride. Whitebeard is the man I respect most!
quotes.speaker: Portgas D. Ace
quotes.context: Ace explaining his allegiance to Whitebeard

events.title: Flashback: Ace's Conflicting Dreams with Luffy
events.description: In the Arabasta flashback, Ace and Luffy discuss their dreams of becoming Pirate King. Despite both wanting the same ultimate goal, they share a moment of mutual respect and brotherly love, with Ace encouraging Luffy's ambitions.
events.significance: Highlights the complexity of their relationship - they are rivals in dreams but brothers in spirit. This duality adds emotional depth to Ace's later sacrifice.

events.title: Flashback: Ace Gives Luffy His Vivre Card
events.description: Before parting ways in Arabasta, Ace gives Luffy his Vivre Card, explaining that the mysterious piece of paper will allow them to meet again. Ace tells Luffy it will lead him to Ace no matter where he is.
events.significance: The Vivre Card becomes a crucial plot device throughout the Summit War Saga, allowing Luffy to track Ace's condition and ultimately guiding the rescue attempt. This moment of brotherly care takes on tragic significance as Luffy later watches the card burn.

quotes.text: This will help us meet again at the top!
quotes.speaker: Portgas D. Ace
quotes.context: Ace giving Luffy his Vivre Card before departing

events.title: Flashback: Luffy's First Encounter with Blackbeard
events.description: The episode recounts Luffy's first meeting with Marshall D. Teach in Mock Town. At the bar, Blackbeard and Luffy sit next to each other and have opposite opinions about cherry pie and drinks, nearly coming to blows over their disagreement.
events.significance: This seemingly insignificant encounter is laden with dramatic irony - Luffy has no idea that this man will be responsible for Ace's capture and the entire Summit War. The scene establishes Blackbeard's character and foreshadows the catastrophic impact he will have on Luffy's life.

quotes.speaker: Marshall D. Teach
quotes.context: Blackbeard's declaration after the bar argument

events.title: Flashback: Bellamy's Crew Mocks Luffy and Blackbeard
events.description: The flashback shows Bellamy and his crew laughing at both Luffy and Blackbeard for believing in dreams like Sky Island and the One Piece. Both Luffy and Blackbeard choose not to fight back despite the humiliation.
events.significance: This parallel between Luffy and Blackbeard emphasizes their similarities as dreamers, making Blackbeard's later betrayal of that dream through his ruthless ambition even more tragic. The scene explores the theme of what it means to be a true pirate.

events.title: Flashback: Luffy Learns of Ace's Execution
events.description: The episode recounts the devastating moment when Luffy, at the Kuja Palace on Amazon Lily, learns from Elder Nyon that Ace is scheduled to be executed at Marineford. The news shocks Luffy to his core and sets him on the path to Impel Down.
events.significance: This is the inciting incident for the entire Summit War Saga. Luffy's decision to rescue Ace, despite the overwhelming odds, demonstrates his unwavering loyalty and sets in motion the events that will change the world forever.

events.title: Flashback: Luffy Confronts Blackbeard at Impel Down
events.description: The episode recalls Luffy's encounter with Blackbeard at Impel Down. Upon seeing the man responsible for Ace's capture, Luffy furiously attacks Blackbeard with his Jet Pistol, making him fly into a wall. However, Jinbe stops Luffy from continuing the fight.
events.significance: This confrontation represents Luffy's first direct retaliation against the man who destroyed his brother's life. Jinbe's intervention highlights the time pressure and forces Luffy to prioritize rescuing Ace over revenge.

events.title: Flashback: Blackbeard Demonstrates Dark-Dark Fruit Powers
events.description: In the Impel Down flashback, Blackbeard retaliates against Luffy's attack by activating his Yami Yami no Mi powers. He uses Kurouzu (Black Hole) to pull Luffy toward him and slam him into the ground, demonstrating the terrifying power of the Dark-Dark Fruit.
events.significance: This flashback reminds viewers of Blackbeard's devastating abilities and reinforces why Ace, despite his Logia-type Mera Mera no Mi, was defeated. The Dark-Dark Fruit's ability to nullify other Devil Fruit powers makes Blackbeard uniquely dangerous.

events.title: Flashback: Jinbe Stops Luffy from Fighting Blackbeard
events.description: Jinbe intervenes to stop Luffy from continuing his battle with Blackbeard, reminding him that Ace's execution is only hours away and they don't have time for a prolonged fight. Jinbe also warns Luffy that Blackbeard was strong enough to defeat Ace, a Logia user.
events.significance: This moment establishes Jinbe's role as Luffy's voice of reason and ally. It also demonstrates Luffy's emotional maturity in being able to prioritize Ace's rescue over his desire for revenge.

quotes.text: Think about your top priority! This man was even able to take down Ace, a Logia user!
quotes.speaker: Jinbe
quotes.context: Jinbe convincing Luffy to abandon the fight with Blackbeard

events.title: Flashback: Blackbeard Reveals His Role in Ace's Capture
events.description: Blackbeard reveals to Luffy that he captured Ace specifically to become a Shichibukai, using Ace as a bargaining chip with the World Government. This revelation adds another layer of calculated cruelty to Blackbeard's actions.
events.significance: This revelation shows the extent of Blackbeard's ruthless ambition - he used his former crewmate Ace as a mere stepping stone in his rise to power. It establishes Blackbeard as a major antagonist who will stop at nothing to achieve his goals.

quotes.text: I captured Ace to become a Shichibukai!
quotes.speaker: Marshall D. Teach
quotes.context: Blackbeard revealing his motivation for capturing Ace

events.title: Ace Recalls His Defeat by Blackbeard
events.description: The scene shifts to Ace imprisoned at Marineford, three hours before his scheduled execution. Ace recalls his fateful encounter with Blackbeard and the battle that led to his capture. He reflects on how he pursued Blackbeard for killing a Whitebeard crewmate.
events.significance: This perspective shift provides Ace's side of the story and shows the circumstances that led to the current crisis. It emphasizes Ace's loyalty to his crew and how that very loyalty led to his downfall.

events.title: Three Hours Before Ace's Execution
events.description: The episode ends with Ace locked in chains at Marineford, gritting his teeth as he awaits his fate. The narrator ominously states that only three hours remain until the scheduled execution, setting the stage for the upcoming Marineford War.
events.significance: This ending creates intense tension and urgency as the episode transitions from retrospective to present action. The three-hour countdown establishes the ticking clock that will drive the entire Marineford Arc.

themes.description: The episode deeply explores the bond between Luffy and Ace, showing how their childhood connection drives Luffy's desperate rescue attempt despite impossible odds.
themes.symbolism: The burning Vivre Card serves as a powerful symbol of Ace's fading life and the urgency of Luffy's mission.

themes.description: The episode contrasts different approaches to pursuing dreams through Luffy, Ace, and Blackbeard - showing both noble and ruthless paths to achieving one's ambitions.
themes.symbolism: Blackbeard's declaration that 'a pirate's dream never ends' takes on dark irony given his willingness to sacrifice others for his own goals.

themes.description: Ace's loyalty to Whitebeard and his pursuit of Blackbeard for killing a crewmate demonstrates the theme of honor, even when it leads to personal tragedy.
themes.symbolism: The Whitebeard Pirates' mark on Ace's back represents his pride and loyalty.

themes.description: The three-hour countdown to Ace's execution creates overwhelming tension and emphasizes the limited time Luffy has to save his brother.
themes.symbolism: The burning Vivre Card represents time running out.

mangaDifferences.difference: This episode is anime-original filler content created as a recap/retrospective before the Marineford Arc. There is no corresponding manga chapter.

trivia.fact: Episode 457 is the first episode of the Marineford Arc, but it is entirely a retrospective/recap episode with no new plot advancement.
This episode received a TV rating of 10.5% in Japan, ranking #3 for its time slot.
The episode uses footage from Episodes 101, 146, 416, and 447, creating a cohesive narrative from Luffy's perspective.

Opening 12 'Kaze wo Sagashite' was performed by Mari Yaguchi and Straw Hat. Episode 457 was the second-to-last episode to use this opening, as Episode 458 was the final episode before switching to 'One Day' by THE ROOTLESS.
